# IR Codes for the Denon Receiver Remote
These codes were captured with an ESP32 device running ESPHome, wired up with an IR Receiver.  This is a random remote that was acquired with a no-name LED discoball light; model number AO-6666 is present on the device.  Codes are provided as the raw output from remote.pronto.


## ESPHome configuration for capturing IR

I heavily referenced the following resources to get this configuration created:
- [Setting up Remote / IR Devices](https://new.esphome.io/guides/setting_up_rmt_devices/)
- [Setting up a Remote / IR Transmitter](https://esphome.io/components/remote_transmitter/)
- [Sensus IR code converter](https://pasthev.github.io/sensus/) (Very helpful for translating pronto output into something that can be fed in to an ESPHome YAML; the actual project on Github is here: https://github.com/pasthev/sensus)

Here's the code block I used for my ESPHome config.
```yaml
esphome:
  name: esp32-00
  friendly_name: esp32-00

esp32:
  board: esp32dev
  framework:
    type: esp-idf

# Enable logging
logger:

# Enable Home Assistant API
api:
  encryption:
    key: "[]" # Removed for privacy

ota:
  - platform: esphome
    password: "[]" # Removed for privacy

wifi:
  ssid: !secret wifi_ssid
  password: !secret wifi_password
  manual_ip:
    # Set this to the IP of the ESP
    static_ip: 192.168.2.200
    # Set this to the IP address of the router. Often ends with .1
    gateway: 192.168.2.1
    # The subnet of the network. 255.255.255.0 works for most home networks.
    subnet: 255.255.255.0

  # Enable fallback hotspot (captive portal) in case wifi connection fails
  ap:
    ssid: "Esp32-00 Fallback Hotspot"
    password: "wuZKRp6Q52LL"

captive_portal:

# For this, I wired up the "OUT" pin on my IR Receiver to GPIO #15 on my ESP32.  Used an ESP32-WOOX device.
remote_receiver:
  pin: GPIO15
  dump: all
```

## ESPHome configuration for transmitting IR
_Note: this was generated by Claude and may require tweaking._

``` yaml
# IR Transmitter setup (add this if you don't have it already)
remote_transmitter:
  pin: GPIO15  # Your IR LED pin
  carrier_duty_percent: 50%

# All buttons
button:
  - platform: template
    name: "On/Off"
    on_press:
      - remote_transmitter.transmit_pronto:
          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0163 00AB 0018 0015 0018 0016 0017 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0016 0017 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0180"

  - platform: template
    name: "DMX On/Off"
    on_press:
      - remote_transmitter.transmit_pronto:
          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0163 00AB 0018 0015 0017 0015 0018 0014 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0016 0018 0014 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003E 0019 003D 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0019 003D 0018 003E 0018 003F 0019 0015 0018 0014 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 0016 0018 0014 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0019 003D 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 0180"

  - platform: template
    name: "Stop/Start"
    on_press:
      - remote_transmitter.transmit_pronto:
          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0162 00AB 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 0016 0017 0015 0018 0016 0017 0015 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 0016 0017 0015 0017 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0016 0017 003F 0018 0180"

  - platform: template
    name: "Music 1"
    on_press:
      - remote_transmitter.transmit_pronto:
          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0162 00AB 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 0015 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 0016 0017 0015 0018 0016 0017 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 0016 0017 0015 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 0016 0017 0015 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0180"

  - platform: template
    name: "Music 2"
    on_press:
      - remote_transmitter.transmit_pronto:
          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0162 00AB 0019 0014 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0016 0018 0014 0019 0014 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003F 0019 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0019 003E 0019 003E 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 0014 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0016 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 0180"

  - platform: template
    name: "Music 3"
    on_press:
      - remote_transmitter.transmit_pronto:
          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0161 00AB 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003E 0019 003D 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 003E 0019 0014 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0019 003E 0018 0180"

    name: "Flash"
    on_press:
      - remote_transmitter.transmit_pronto:
          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0164 00AB 0018 0016 0017 0015 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 0015 0018 0015 0018 0016 0017 0015 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 0016 0017 0016 0017 0015 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0180"

    name: "A1"
    on_press:

          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0161 00AB 0018 0015 0017 0015 0018 0015 0017 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0017 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0015 0017 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0017 003F 0018 0180"

    name: "A6"
    on_press:

          data: "0000 006D 0022 0000 0164 00AB 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003E 0018 0015 0018 00
```          


## Raw IR data per button
Quick note: "Why does my remote send the IR codes in triplicate?"  I turned to Claude for the answer:

>Most consumer IR remotes transmit each command multiple times (typically 2-4 repetitions). Here's why:

>**Reliability and error correction** - IR communication is inherently unreliable. The signal can be blocked by obstacles, weakened by distance, or interfered with by ambient light (especially sunlight or fluorescent lights). Sending the same code multiple times dramatically increases the chance that at least one transmission gets through successfully.

>**No acknowledgment system** - Unlike more sophisticated protocols, IR is one-way communication. The remote has no way to know if the TV actually received the command, so it can't do selective retransmission. Sending multiple copies upfront is the simple solution.
Button press detection - The repetition also helps distinguish between different types of button presses:

>**A brief tap might send the code 2-3 times** - Holding the button down sends continuous repetitions, which the TV interprets as "keep doing this action" (like volume up)

>**Three repetitions is right in the sweet spot for most remotes** - it's enough redundancy to be reliable without being wasteful. Some protocols like NEC will send the initial code, then if you hold the button, switch to sending shorter "repeat codes" rather than the full command each time.

>Your ESP32 IR receiver is working exactly as expected by picking up all three transmissions. Most devices that decode IR are programmed to accept the first valid code and ignore duplicates within a short time window.

### On/Off
One press.
```
[16:19:33.168][I][remote.pronto:229]: Received Pronto: data=
[16:19:33.168][I][remote.pronto:237]: 0000 006D 0022 0000 0163 00AB 0018 0015 0018 0016 0017 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 0016 0017 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 
[16:19:33.177][I][remote.pronto:237]: 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003E 0018 003F 0018 003F 0018 0015 0018 003F 0018 0180 
```
Held down.
```
[16:18:05.724][I][remote.pronto:229]: Received Pronto: data=
[16:18:05.726][I][remote.pronto:237]: 0000 006D 0002 0000 0166 0055 0018 0180 
```
